thread.title: Top 5 Autumn Breaks UK Destinations

author: admin
title: Top 5 Autumn Breaks UK Destinations
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > Top 5 Autumn Breaks UK Destinations Top 5 Autumn Breaks UK Destinations By admin on October 8, 2015 Pin It 
Autumn, the best part of the year when nature takes its turn and re shades itself with the beautiful patches of yellow, orange and even red with a hint of green. 
We all eagerly wait for autumn and the UK is probably one of the best places to enjoy this part of the year to its true extend. Some of the finest places where autumn strikes with its natural beauty can be found in and around the UK. Autumn Breaks UK Destinations 
Have a look at some of the best autumn breaks UK destination to enjoy the colors of autumn this year: Westonbirt Arboretum Photo Credits: geograph.org.uk 
Westonbirt Arboretum is located near Gloucestershire, which is maintained by Forestry Commission, UK. Westonbirt is spread across 600 acres of land, which is one of finest collections of trees in the world. 
It has a wide collection of bladdernut, lime and maple species. In the Westonbirt Manor which is now a school, you can enjoy the Holford Ride which gives you a stunning view. Various events are held like fungi workshops for children and exploration campaign. Grizedale Forest Photo Credits: Chris Leech 
Grizedale forest is one of the best autumn breaks UK destinations, which is located in Lake District in the North Western England. It is situated between Hawkshead and Coniston Water is known as the wooden gem. Ancient woodlands and green pines provide the backdrop where rusting larch, elder and oak grow. 
This is one of the popular tourist destinations in UK, which is too maintained by Forestry Commission. Along with enjoying the autumn colors, you can also enjoy mountain biking, zip lines, Tarzan swings, aerial assault course, and view of many sculptures made out of stone, and wood. Sherwood Forest Photo Credits: Ken Hircock 
Sherwood Forest is yet another wonderful forest to visit during autumn breaks in UK. This forest is Royal Forest in Nottinghamshire, England, and it is better known for its association with legendary character Robin Hood. 
This is a popular tourist destination in UK, which attracts many tourists throughout the year, and particularly during the month of August, when weeklong Robin-Hood festival is hosted by national reserve. Another important tourist spot is the Major Oak tree, which was the Robin Hoodâ€™s hideout. Symonds Yat Photo Credits: Jake Hancock 
Symonds Yat villageis one of the popular tourist destinations in UK, and it is located beside River Wye, and in the Forest of Dean. This is another great place to enjoy the colors of autumn in UK. 
You can have a spectacular view of River Wye, and the forest from Symonds Yat Rock view point. Along with enjoying scenic autumn beauties, you can enjoy activities like boat trips, canoeing, kayaking, etc. Castell Coch Photo Credits: telegraph.co.uk 
Castell Coch in Wales is yet another place that you can visit during the autumn to experience the beautiful colors of the autumnal tress ranging from rusty burgundy to gold. Castell Coch is a Gothic Revival Castle located in Tongwynlais Village, South Wales. 
The woods that are surrounding the castle are filled with copper beech woodlands, which is really stunning to see during autumn.
